resources.string: Need an account? Sign up now!

Description :

Venn diagrams are an important tool allowing relations between sets to be visualized graphically. This chapter introduces the use of Venn diagrams to visualize intersections and unions of set, as well as subsets and supersets.

Description :

Introduction to the product rule, which tells us how to take the derivative of a product of functions.
The product rule is a formal rule for differentiating problems where one function is multiplied by another. The rule follows from the limit definition of derivative. Each time, differentiate a different function in the product and add the two terms together.

Description :

This video explains about the pulmonary system including the lungs, larynx, trachea, bronchi, alveoli and thoracic diaphragm in a detailed manner. And also the functions of the arteries and veins in the lung system.

Description :

This video shows how elements relate to atoms. The basics of how protons, electrons and neutrons make up an atom.
Chemistry is the study of matter: its composition, properties, and reactivity. This material roughly covers a first-year high school or college course, and a good understanding of algebra is helpful.

Description: 

This video shows an example of calculating the speed and velocity.
Physics is the study of the basic principles that govern the physical world around us. We will start by looking at motion itself. Then, we will learn about forces, momentum, energy and other concepts in lots of different physical situations.

Description :

This animated "Math Shorts" explains algebraic equations and provides a concrete example of how they can be used to answer Real-World questions.

Description :

The chain rule states that the derivative of "f(g(x)) is f\'(g(x))_g'(x)". In other words, it helps us differentiate *composite functions*. For example, "sin(x_)" is a composite function because it can be constructed as "f(g(x)) for f(x)=sin(x) and g(x)=x_". Using the chain rule and the derivatives of "sin(x) and x_", we can then find the derivative of "sin(x_)".

Description :

This video explains about the movement of red blood cells within the human body and also oxygen uptake by hemoglobin in red blood cells. As well as the transfer of oxygen through the lungs to every part of our body.

Description :

This video shows the difference between atomic weight and atomic mass in chemistry, and how it compares to the physics definitions of weight and mass.
 Chemistry is the study of matter: its composition, properties, and reactivity. This material roughly covers a first-year high school or college course, and a good understanding of algebra is helpful.

Description: 

This video shows a simple example of sovling for time given distance and rate.
Physics is the study of the basic principles that govern the physical world around us. We will start by looking at motion itself. Then, we will learn about forces, momentum, energy and other concepts in lots of different physical situations.
